meanings.definition: To cause something to go off course or off track.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was derailing the train from reaching its destination.
meanings.sent2: The heavy snow was derailing the bus schedule.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was derailing the bird feeder by stealing all the seeds.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden outburst derailed the meeting, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected rainstorm derailed our picnic plans.

meanings.definition: To obstruct or hinder progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The lack of funding was derailing the construction project.
meanings.sent2: His constant interruptions were derailing the team's brainstorming session.
meanings.sent3: The broken printer was derailing the office workflow.
meanings.sent4: The negative feedback derailed her confidence temporarily.
meanings.sent5: The sudden power outage derailed the presentation.
